Reviews.Title: “Surprised at the Great Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Pamgoes
Reviews.Content: Since this is one of the older Marriott timeshare venues, we were a little hesitant to book here. Well, we should have known that Marriott would live up to its good reputation! The unit was spotless! Wonderful facilities, great corner unit with view of the golf course, full screened porch...and the best for us as grandparents of 3 very active grandgirls...we had full access to the Marriott World Hotel next door so they could swim, slide, play, and run to their hearts content at the great hotel pools and activities center. Check in was slightly delayed by about an hour, but we were offered all sorts of distractions to keep us 'busy' including a big screen TV and computer stations and the timeshare pool. The location is very near Lake Buena Vista, Disney's shopping venue, and World Drive which leads to Epcot and Animal Kingdom. Plenty of dining venues nearby so don't worry that there isn't an onsight restaurant. Shuttle service to the Marriott World Center is on call always, so you can always get there for 3 meals a day! We had a great time just 'hanging out' and will be happy to return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “You and your family will love it.”
Reviews.Author: kimamc16
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Royal Palms and loved it. We had four generations staying and everyone was pleased and all needs were met. The two bedroom suits with full kitchen and living room and dining area was all we needed. The master bath is wonderful with a HUGE jacuzzi tub. There is added seating at the kitchen counter area that took care of the kids. The screened in patio was wonderful for those who stayed up late to drink some wine and continue chatting into the night. We had minor issues like the ice maker was broken and a bathroom sink drained slowly however with one phone call within minutes a gentleman arrived and fixed everything. Great service. The surrounding view is a beautiful golf course and its fun to watch as some hit the green and others end up in the sand traps or worse. The Palms is an easy drive within minutes of Disney. Trust me, just go for it......you'll love the Royal Palms.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families.”
Reviews.Author: travelingfsugirl
Reviews.Content: Awesome place to stay if going to amusement parks as a family. They have great amenities and the rooms were roomy, clean, and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Carol T
Reviews.Content: Even though the infrastructure (outside building and room size) look good the service is just terrible! They did not clean the room, the beds were not made up and we even found cockroaches! Will definitely not come back and would recommend to avoid this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare Exchange - Disney Trip”
Reviews.Author: Shoostry
Reviews.Content: It was an excellent stay - great location, friendly staff, clean & spacious suites and good onsite amenities. We did not spend a lot of time at the resort as this was a Disney trip except for 1 day that my wife and daughter spent in the pools and spa (I played golf). Location: It is 3 miles from Disney Parks - the main entrance to the resort group (Royal Palms is part of 5 other Marriott resorts in the same location - though spread out) is on the highway that leads straight to Disney Parks. The Royal Palms snakes around Hawks Landing golf course (more on that later). It is 6 miles from Sea World (easy route to and from) and 35 mins from Lego Land (no doubt the best park of them all). Resort: Clean & spacious with great staff. They were accommodating and pleasant to deal with. The 2 bedroom suites were spacious with usual but latest amenities (washer, dryer, flat screen TV's, iron/board, etc.). The balcony is covered with table & chairs - so no bugs or debris gets in - great for morning breakfast! We could see the 16th green and the lake which was great. The master bedroom has a jacuzzi tub, which was great - plenty of towels and soap/shampoo/toilet paper (they do not service rooms if u are resort exchange - so unless u are a messy person/family then you will complain). The rooms come with safe's and flat screen TV's - the living room has a DVD player also. There are pools all over the resorts (you can use ALL the pools in ANY of the resorts on the property - great deal since they have a large indoor pool as well). You can grill and even do simple grocery shopping in the Royal Palms check-in center (Market Place) - but as expected it is expensive - par for any resort/hotel you may travel to. There is plenty of parking, and they even have transportation to take you to/from to other resorts/golf course/restaurants in the Marriott community. Onsite basketball, tennis and shuffle board courts - small but functional workout room. So all in all, a lot to do and be comfortable with. Restaurant: The restaurants in the Marriott resorts are expensive, the food is good but it's wiser to eat out for better quality with the same prices - and there are plenty of restaurants within 10 miles. We went to Orlando convention center area (about 10 miles) and there are a lot of choices - including upscale retail shopping. They have a lot of delivery services that come to the resort so you have that option too. Spa: The wife used it and said it was good...and they have packages for kids too. Golf: Hawks Landing is a good course. Not overtly difficult but water is in play on 15 holes (with Gators!). The greens are 8/9 on the stimp meter and the course is in great shape. The staff is friendly (the manager ended up being from my home town!) and it is easy to get on. However - this place is pricey ($124 with rental clubs in the afternoon) for the type of course it is, so I would recommend that you look online for coupons - the guys I was paired with did that (golflinks or tee-time watch). But easy on and u can get the local shuttle to/from the resort. Timeshare: The exchange was easy and we got no peer pressure to go sit through a presentation. When we checked-in we were directed to the timeshare people - they were very polite and not pushy but tried to offer me a free round of golf to come sit thru a presentation - a polite no was all that was needed. They did give us a lot of travel maps and visitor info however so I was pleasantly surprised. If you do decide to go (they can give u a lot of cool perks - parks tix's, golf rounds etc.) make sure u drive yourself to the presentation center and not take the bus - as then you are at their mercy - prior experience! Parks: The entrance to the Disney parks is only 3 miles. Then there are splits to all the different parks once u enter the main gate. We visited Magic and Animal Kingdom (our daughter is only 5 - so other parks did not make sense - too young) and the drive is simple and easy from the resort. Parking is $14/day but it is VERY efficient and I still marvel of how coordinated it is (you have to take a people/shuttle to the park). Though after a full day coming back and waiting for the people movers can be tiring for some though we did not have a problem at all. Word to the wise - if going to Magic Kingdom - split the park into two days (left side and right side of the parks). Animal Kingdom is fun but can be covered in one day. The water rides are awesome. CAUTION: ALL Disney rides are VERY short (except Peter Pan) so going off-season is recommended (we were there Dec 3-10) - I cannot imagine going peak season and having to wait 30 mins to 1 hour (which is very common) for a 1 or 2 min ride. We never waited more than 5 mins for any ride except one. Sea World is amazing and worth the trip. The Dolphin and Killer Whale shows (35 mins each) are worth the admission price and they do have cool rides there! Lego Land is by far the best of them all...it brought the kid out in me. It is about 35 mins from the resort but an easy drive. EVERYTHING is made of Lego including life size Darth Vader, Ford Explorer, etc. The rides are amazing - perfect for young kids - my daughter and i rode each ride atleast 4 times and she LOVED it (Coastasaurus rocks!). The driving school is fun and the kids actually drive their own car! The miniature cities will dumbfound you - did I mention everything is made of LEGO!...the details of DC, Seattle, Paris,etc...amazing and you need to spend time reviewing everything...don't pick it as the last event to see!

Reviews.Title: “Gift Card Issue”
Reviews.Author: NESteven
Reviews.Content: Our only concern with our stay was using a holiday gift card to pay part of our bill. I didn't know how much was on the gift card. The person at the desk checked and told me it was for $25, which he subtracted from the bill. I found out later that day that the gift card was for $50. Fortunately, we were still in Orlando, so we returned that night and told the person working the desk the situation. He checked and found the card was for $50. He was very helpful in getting the account adjusted. Other than the card fiasco, the rest of our visit, the service and the accommodations were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: ericacarter
Reviews.Content: This place was so convenient and comfortable. The unit was clean, bright, and a good size for the four of us. We loved having the kitchen - especially for breakfast and afternoon drinkds/snacks. The dining room/living room combo was nice, and we had plenty of room to spread out and relax. I was in the master bedroom, which had a very nice bathroom. The tub is in the bedroom, which was a little strange, but we didn't use it. I have never had so many towels in a room -- it was amazing! The pool there is nice, but we spent most of our time at the World Center pool, which was very resort-like. It was an easy walk to the WC pool -- just watch out for the golf carts! I usually stay in hotels, but I was very impressed with this timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JKS
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights before a stay with family.We could have easily and happily stayed a week! Check in was a breeze. We had an early flight and arrived before noon. Unit was clean and well maintained. Lovely golf course view. We are Marriott time share owners, so familiar with basic layout, amenities, etc. The bonus of nightly stays is the daily tidy service. The master bedroom is large, with a king size bed, 2 night stands, a dresser, flat panel TV, and desk. There are dual vanities, a jacuzzi tub, and a closet with safe (not laptop size) within the bedroom. There is a separate water closet and shower. The second bedroom has a queen bed, and as has been said before, a futon style second bed. The second bed is not very comfortable, but was ok for my 11 y/o son. It was nice to have a separate bed, as my children were sharing the room. There is a closet, a nightstand, dresser, and flat panel TV. The second bath is just outside of the bedroom and has a tub/shower combo. Kitchen has been updated recently. The cabinets are in great shape, and the pots and pans all look very new. The kitchen is very nicely equipped and large enough to actually move around in. There is a counter with barstools (3 or 4, I don't remember). The dining area has a large table with 4 chairs. Ours was an end unit, so we had a window in the dining area. There is a laundry room with full size washer and dryer. Living room had a sofa bed and 2 chairs. Large TV cabinet, flat panel TV, DVD player (which we never could get to work). Screened balcony with table and chairs. We would have enjoyed a few dinners out there had we stayed longer! It was nice to sit out with coffee in the morning. The unit has an abundance of storage. Free wi-fi connection is nice. There are also computers and printer in lobby for a fee. I needed to print SeaWorld tix and had some difficulty with the printer. Alejandro was incredibly helpful and printed them for me at the front desk. In fact, he was outdtanding from the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out. The kids enjoyed the pool areas at both Royal/Imperial Palms and the adjacent Marriott World Center. There is a shuttle that will take you back and forth. They also enjoyed playing basketball. They have balls, tennis rackets, and other recreational equipment to borrow. Parking is free and easy. Elevators are available in all of the buildings. They do recycle, which is nice - so many resorts do not. SeaWorld is a short drive and Disney is just across the highway (we have stayed at Sabal Palms and the Marriott for Disnay in the past). There are 2 Publix within a 10 minute drive, and a Walmart Super Center about 6 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location 4.7 out of 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Newport_Renter
Reviews.Content: I thought the unit was smaller than it should be. I am very familiar with 2 bedroom condos. The kitchen layout was funky and the 2nd bedroom had a queen bed and a futon style second bed. Overall very happy. Resort staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service; great location. Would go back next week.”
Reviews.Author: jazzy6991
Reviews.Content: As usual the Marriott service was top notch. The room was spacious and clean. What more could one want. Location is perfect for a Disney family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: chrismiller2523
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Palms which is part of the Marriott Vacation Club destination. We were very impressed by the size of the space. It had a nice, fully equipped kitchen, two bedrooms and a roomy living room. The master had a large jacuzzi tub and a separate shower area. We have two teenage boys and an elementary school aged child so one slept in the full sized bed in the second bedroom, one slept on a day-bed in that bedroom and one on the pullout sofa bed. It worked for us, but may not be ideal if you have more than two bug kids who need or desire more privacy. The furniture and kitchen was updated, but the bathrooms were a little outdated and showed their age a bit, but it more than met our needs. This place was three miles from Disney World so it was super convenient. Make a right turn out of the complex and three miles later (5 minutes) you're driving through the Disney gates! We spent most of our time at the theme parks, but enjoyed a down day by the pool. Don't miss the big pool over at the near by Marriott World Center. The pool is huge, with pool-side food and beverage service and has a great water slide. They also had outdoor barbecue grills both gas and charcoal which we used one night. We were very happy with this stay.

Reviews.Title: “noise form freeway”
Reviews.Author: TPOregon
Reviews.Content: We stayed overlooking golf course 3rf floor 2 bedroom condo.The condo was flawless but I was surprised at the nosie form the freeways all nite long. It was very loud even with all doors closed.

Reviews.Title: “Exceed Expectations”
Reviews.Author: tps25701
Reviews.Content: I needed to get away for a little personal R&R and this was the perfect place! The staff was very professional and suite was immaculate. The location was convenient to local night life for fun and my patio overlooking one of the greens and water hazard was perfect place to enjoy my meals and read during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Knockout!”
Reviews.Author: Chapmanbilly
Reviews.Content: Marriott has certainly done its homework when it comes to hotel and timeshare venues. We exchanged into this property for week in August. Had to drag reluctant-to-leave wife away from unit at end of week. First impressions are favourable re location, settings and surroundings - and then it just gets better. Our unit was spacious, well-equipped and clean. Comfortable lounge and full kitchen were appreciated - also, no problem in sleeping. Didn't use the swimming pool as regularly as we should have done - careless. World Centre has larger pool, but much noisier, if you get my drift. Splendid view over golf course and sunsets from veranda. Very, very impressed - I, too, was reluctant to leave. Definitely raises the bar.

Reviews.Title: “clean, quiet place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jdb01
Reviews.Content: If you would like a clean quiet place to stay this is it. It is one of four hotels on the property. It is a typical Marriott Timeshare. The staff is friendly and capable. The rooms stay clean and the property is immaculate. There are some activities on grounds, but these are more of a rainy day affair, or when you don't want to do anything theme park. It is very Disney located. The front drive enters on to 536 which is the main entrance into Disney. Grocery stores are almost right around the corner, but not in walking distance. The pools are large and well-kept. You are allowed to use any of the property pools, but one is as good as another. There is a small store on grounds, but way too expensive and too little variety. If you want to shop for food and essentials, there is a Walmart within 5 minutes. There are plenty of national chain restaurants within a few minutes and two outlet malls. I always enjoy staying at a Marriott timeshare. You always get what you pay for, clean comfortable and centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in everyway”
Reviews.Author: JackieFranklinNC
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this special villa hotel-Friendly check in--Villas were spacious, spotless, and perfect for family. The master bedroom is huge and features a very large jacuzzi. The guest bedroom has an extra twin bed that doubles as a sitting area. Neat layout--featuring angles and mirrors in living and dining area. Kitchen is modern with beautiful tiled flooring and tile wall area. Everything you could possibly need for the perfect vacation. Marriott has once more proven to know what the discriminating traveler wants in a vacation. A great weekend get away!! Would love to stay weeks at this resort. We were located on the golf course. Beautifully landscaped areas to include a serenity area, as well as an herb garden. When we arrived, other guests were enjoying the grills on the property- Even though it was a holiday weekend, there was no noise within the resort property.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: MissTH
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this place. The service was excellent from the moment we arrived. The food was excellent. Staff is very friendly and made every effort to make sure our stay was enjoyable. We will definetely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Would go back in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl H
Reviews.Content: Myself, husband and 2 teenage girls spent 7 days here and absolutely loved it! The room was large with a great screened patio area, areas to hang together, or separate, and was very clean and all appliances were in working order. We loved how close it was to all of the attractions! One word of advise that was given to us - ask for a room that faces the golf course - that was so beautiful and peaceful! The buses to and from the Marriott World center ran often - and were called in a timely fashion to get us back and forth. Our only complaint was that the game room for the kids could have been a little larger, with more games. Still, we all enjoyed the pool and the grounds! Lastly, every single person there was friendly, helpful and fun! Very, very nice vacation for my family!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for visiting Disney Parks - just average quality”
Reviews.Author: mb_travel6359
Reviews.Content: This resort is in a great location minutes from Disney World. It was nice enough, but below typical Marriott resort standards. Royal Palms is no better than average quality.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: DIORLOU
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several marriotts and I have to say this has been one of the best! The only issue we had was the room keys were not working and I had to go to the front desk twice it was a bit of an inconvenience because the villa was not very near the registration office. Howvever the third time we had an issue I decided to call them from my cell phone to send someone to get it fixed. It was a bit frustrating especially because we were in a hurry to settle in and get started on our Disney vacation. After we saw the villa inside the frustration disappeared. Our only regret was not staying longer! We will definitely comeback again and recommend this Marriott to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: paperbag41
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 1 night to go to disney's Magic Kingdom. the room was big and nice but in one of the rooms there was a scratch on the wall and a stain on one of the pillows. Plus no breakfast available.The master had a big tub with jacuzzi jets. The pool was huge and heated but it only went as deep as 5 feet.Checkout was 10 am earlier than any other hotel we have stayed at before.Service was unfriendly.Otherwise it was a great place to stay. It is right across from the nickaloden hotel. (This is a guest review by my 8-year old daughter!)

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: KiwiTraveler914
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd time visiting this resort. We were traveling with a total of 5 adults and 3 children (ages 2.5, 3 and 5). We had 2 2-bedrooms rooms and the size worked perfectly for our group. This hotel is not the newest or fanciest but is clean and well kept. The pool is nothing special but adaquete. It was fairly quiet and our kids were able to be in the pool and playground areas without being pushed around by larger kids. The main reason for our return was the location. Only 2 miles from the entrance to Disney World. Overall, decent place and a good option for non-Disney hotel when traveling to Disney parks

Reviews.Title: “It was an enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: ObjectiveUnknown
Reviews.Content: We traveled in April 2011 and stay at the Marriott Royal Palms. The weather was terrific the entire time we were there. We visited all the Disney properties and Universal Studios. The staff at the Marriott was super. The Royal Palms, Sabal Palms, Imperial Palms and Marriot World Center all seem to be connected and offer shuttle services between each properties. However, it does not offer shuttle services to any theme parks, the airport nor any off site location. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa on the third floor with a great view of the golf course. The villa has a screened balcony patio so that youâ€™re not annoyed by the pests in the area. The unit showed some aging but it was welled maintained overall. Not outdated as there were some upgrades done to the unit. The shower in the master bedroom was slow to drain. The staff were so professional and friendly that I'm confident that it would have been fixed if I really needed fixed. Everything else works and operate appropriately as we function checked everything. The Royal Palms does have a small marketplace that offers limited supplies to stock your villa for your convenience; however, the area is surrounded by freeways. If you want to get to any real shops, I would recommend having your own transportation. The other businesses are nearby and possibly within walking distance but I would not recommend crossing the freeways on foot. Taxi from the Airport to Royal Palm cost us about $50.00 one way. The Airport also offers a round trip shuttle service through Mears Shuttle for $96.00. We found it more convenient to have a rental car to get around and save some money. Overall, we had a great time and another enjoyable stay at the Marriott. I would stay here again in the future and definitely recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice/Peaceful/Clean.”
Reviews.Author: HappyCanuk
Reviews.Content: Royal Palms was very relaxing. The pool area very peaceful with lots of spots for shade. Rooms very nice . 2nd bedroom with full size bed and a separate bench bed that was very comfortable. Large parking spots to make it easy to park larger vehicles. Location perfect to visit the parks and close to grocery and all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “what a relief! civilized accomodations :)”
Reviews.Author: sondrad
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Marriott World after running from the horrow show at the Sheraton Vistana. It was like an oasis. Beautiful, spacious, clean rooms. Gorgeous view of the golf course from a screened lanai. Even the reception desk area was refreshing: cool, crisp tureens of lemon and orange scented ice water, smiling gracious staff. We were in heaven. Stayed in the Royal Palms section: two bedroom, two full bath, laundry, kitchen, dining room and living room. Granite counters, real wood cabinetry. Lots of sun (end unit). The closest pool was accomodating, but lacked refreshment amenities. The main pool (convenient shuttle service) was enormous! We felt totally at ease with a variety of pools, hot tubs and pool decks to liunge around. A choice of two or three poolside pubs and eateries. We really couldn't have asked for a better end to our vacation. Marriott was a redemption after the Sheraton. Conevenient to Disney and easy on /off I4. A go to for us in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Disney but needs work”
Reviews.Author: Enjoylife14
Reviews.Content: First I'd like to say that Royal Palms is so convenient to Disney. The two bedroom condo was updated with white bedding and nice countertops in the kitchen but the unit itself is old. The carpet was stained, the bathroom, foyer and kitchen floors were dirty, the showers had mildew in them, and one toilet made a leak noise. If housekeeping did a better job I think the unit would look better. Also, did not like the daily messages for unit owners and the call from sales the first day there. Don't waste my time! I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some sprucing up”
Reviews.Author: Alasunk
Reviews.Content: We like the resort. We have spent a week there each year for the last 10 years. Rooms are ok but dated and worn a bit. The outside of the rooms are not as clean as in years past. Elevator, stairs etc. Pools are great, the staff is wonderful and accomodationg. We will probably be back in March. We will post or experience.Great location for Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home, but a close trip to Disney”
Reviews.Author: iliketostayhome
Reviews.Content: Our first family vacation. My oldest is 11. This place was a hit with the family! I saved for years for a trip to Disney and we stayed 10 nights here. The staff was very helpful with suggestions. The 2 bedroom villa was spacious. The master bedroom had a jacuzzi tub, and was a relief after a big day of walking! The convenience store in the lobby had a decent selection of goods for a decent price-you pay for convenience but not gouged. You need a shuttle or taxi wherever you go, not much to walk to. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent home base for Disney/Universal trip”
Reviews.Author: ashleyvalgardson
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bath suite: 2 families, 4 adults, 3 kids. It was the perfect size for us. The kitchen was large with plenty of cupboard space to store each of our week's worth of groceries. There was a laundry room to do (daily!) cleaning, and the office brought up new towels, high chair, baby cribs, etc. whenever we called. The dining room and patio table provided plenty of seating and the living room also had plenty of cupboard space to store the kids toys. Loved the space! The pool on site wasn't amazing, but the pool-side grills were! And you can quickly hop on a shuttle up to the Marriott World Center to go to a huge pool complete with kiddie pool, jacuzzi, and water slide - not to mention the waterfalls. Great spot, only 2 miles from Disney, perfect week stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At Royal Palms!”
Reviews.Author: travelprincess8
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Royal Palms from October 21st to October 29. The place was great. Spotless when we arrived. The kitchen is beautiful. We spent a few days at the pool at the World Center. The pool area is fabulous! My grandchildren loved at as we did. It is also close to Disney and Universal. Grounds are kept up nicely and the pool areas are very clean and the water was heated just right. Everything was perfect and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “out of this world!”
Reviews.Author: ballisticbelinda
Reviews.Content: Pricey shop but convinient-the only complaint. Accommodation marvellous-pools breathtaking,wonderful location,great break!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasurable”
Reviews.Author: GotaGo2Da
Reviews.Content: Very Nice! Used the short-stay exchange from Interval International for the first time and it works great. The Royal Palms was a pleasure. Quick check-in and no struggle after another crummy Continental flight. Both of us felt more comfortable and at ease than at other places we have stayed. Clean, lots of towels, everything worked fine, and well maintained. We liked not being nickel and dimed. No parking problem, no charge for printing out boarding passes, no charge for WiFi, no bugs, as in other reviews. Every villa had a screened in patio. People were all around, but nothing hectic or loud. The grounds are really pretty. And a positive for every timeshare owner...Walmart's is not far away. Next time we go to Orlando, we will look for availability here first...But NOT on Continental!

Reviews.Title: “Just Like Home”
Reviews.Author: Lekenya76
Reviews.Content: Today we are wrapping up our four night stay at Royal Palms. We haven't stayed here in years. We are now glad we came back. The villa was fantastic. The balcony was so clean I was out there morning and evening every night of our stay. We will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tamara68
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay with the Royal Palms. The room was very clean and spacious. I have stayed at other Marriott properties that were newer than Royal Palms, but Marriott is still living up to their reputation. When we first arrived, the staff was very friendly and helpful. Once we got in the room, two of the TV's weren't working. We called the front desk and they had someone there within 15 mins. The daily tidy service was great! We will definitely stay at Royal Palms when we visit Disney in the future. Thanks Marriott for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful time had by all....”
Reviews.Author: Geoff1725
Reviews.Content: Rooms are awesomely decorated. Flat screens in all rooms granite counters in the kitchen and living room. We had room 4184, great view of the pool at this resort with the World Center in the background. I never sleep good at any hotel, timeshare etc.. I slept like a baby all 6 nights. Ac worked great, fridge worked great , oven, dishwasher, washer and dryer, whirl pool, ceiling fans. Just great in every way. You get the shuttle to the World Center at the lobby and it runs all day and night takes about 5 minutes on the shuttle and 15 walking. The pool is large and is heated at the Royal Palms. There are two hot tubs in a secluded area of the pool deck. The pool at the World center is huge and not as heated but is at a nice temp when the feels like temp is 110. All the grounds are in great shape with lots of greenery everywhere. The front desk staff were very nice and attentive to all the guests. Especially Luis and Julie, both of the Julie's. Very nice 2 bedroom villa. We had 2 adults in the master, 2 teenagers in the other bedroom (double bed with a single day bed) and 2 teenagers in the living room pullout. We never felt crowded at all.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place for familys with teenage girls”
Reviews.Author: kansasbeachbabe
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. We travelled with six teenage girls and it was wonderful to have three bathrooms in our unit. The units were big and spacious and spotlessly clean upon checkin. We had a three bedroom, three bathroom unit that slept 10. We called a couple of times to get more lightbulbs replaced or have something fixed, and they were there right away and resolved the problem, no problem and no excuses. When I asked for additional chairs they only asked "how many" and had them there within minutes. Check in was fast and their smiles were genuine. It was the most painless check in we have ever had. The pools were fabulous, huge and clean with lots of room for everyone. Plus they stayed open until 11 pm, so you could go to the pool and cool off after a hot day at the theme parks. They are located really close to Sea World, so we got to see the Sea World fireworks from the balcony each night. This resort has both a beautiful natural setting and one of the best cnntral locations in the Orlando area. There was a security patrol that we saw making the rounds frequently. My gilrs always felt safe out walking around the resort. There is a beautiful lake that has a walking path all around it that is lovely. It also has benches and swings so you can sit and watch the paddle boats on the lake. at night all of the lights reflect in it. We enjopyed having coffeee as we watched the golfers play the holes below. The kitchen was well stocked and very clean. We have stayed in condos and hotels all over the Orlando area and this one is by for the best. we loved it and can't wait to come back. It is by far the nicest one there in every aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Everything good but service terrible”
Reviews.Author: Free4biding03
Reviews.Content: Front desk attitudes were horrible. No smiles and was not helped when faced with a problem with my room keys. Rooms are very nice and clean. Close to all Orlando activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Marriott complex”
Reviews.Author: blue999
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly, and VERY customer oriented. Unit was clean and furnishings were recent. Was some road noise from the unit but this was really only a problem when the police escorts accompanied the Ironman contestants. Spent most of our time using the amenities at the World Center tho the Royal Palm pool area looked fine. Staff at WC was great as well, pool was lovely. Spa was very relaxing. Dinner at Hawks Landing was not cheap (regular steakhouse pricing) but steaks were very good. Short drive to Walmart or CVS for all supplies as well as easy drive to airport. About 2 miles from the start of the Disney property. Outlet mall also nearby. There is a shuttle to the WC and you can charge to your room number for drinks, spa, restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Older Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Chred1
Reviews.Content: Pros: Next to Marriott World Center with double the amenities(kids pool, restaurants, activities, golf), close to Disney, not too far from Universal and Sea World, Like all Vacation Clubs it had a full kitchen, grocery and Wal-Mart/Target within ten minutes, Kids playground Cons: Small Patio, Lots of traffic noise, not as big a unit as other Vacation Clubs, some of the unit had been updated but not all, pool was freezing even though they say it is heated(didn't see a single person use it) It was just ok. Nothing terrible, nothing great. I've been to other much nicer Marriott properties and would probably stay at a different Vacation Club next time in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: kawahl
Reviews.Content: Stayed right before Christmas. Rooms were very spacious. Well kept, top notch. Nice, large kitchen area. Marriott quality. Close to disney(5-10 minutes) Only dowside - pool was not heated as claimed. They told me it was heated to 80. It was no where near that. I decided to check it with a thermometer from the whirlpool and it was 72. Told the front desk and it never changed. Always cold. Disney's blizzard beach was heated. We went there and the water was warm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Surroundings but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: silverfox50charlotte
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at Royal Palms I noticed the beautiful landscaping of all the grounds. The space was adequate but had limitations. We traveled with my mother in law and her husband, my wife and son. At first we noticed the road noise. That was annoying until about 1 am and started again by 6 am. Also we could hear neighbors above us. Last year we stayed at Grand Vista thru our timeshare exchange and loved the arrangments there. Each family had their own balcony and kitchen area. That is great when one family gets up earlier and they have their own private space. The positives were amenites available with the main Marriott center. This hotel was very accomodating. The grounds were immaculate like most Marriotts. The staff was very helpful and responded quickly to a minimal concern. We had a great week there.

Reviews.Title: “All the benefits of a villa but with full hotel service”
Reviews.Author: AndrewT39
Reviews.Content: As a family of four we stayed at Royal Palms for two weeks in August 09. It was exceptional. I stayed at the JW Marriott in Orlando last year andRoyal Palms was much better! Royal Palms is located in the grounds of the Marriott World Center Hotel and is surrounded by the Hawks Landing golf course. It is a Marriott Vacation Club property but we stayed there as rental guests which meant that the room was fully serviced each day just as in a hotel. The apartment we stayed in was in the 42xx block near the swimming pool and as far from the road as possible. Some ofthe other blocks were quite near to S Apopka Vineland Road (SR 535) although all apartments overlooked the golf course from their balconies. Our apartment had two bedrooms. The small bedroom was entered through a small lobby off of which there was a bathroom. The small bedroom had a standard double bed and a single bed. It had a TV and roof fan. The large bedroom was very large and had a king size bed, desk, large drawer unit, TV, double vanity sinks and a large spa bath. Off of the room was a separate shower and WC. The living area of the aprtment was very large. It had a well fitted kitchen (over, hob, microwave, dishwasher, waste disposal, coffee maker), dining area with large round glass table and a lounge area with a sofa a three arm chairs. There was a also a utility room with washing machine and tumble drier. The lounge area led to a balcony with a round table and four chairs. The balcony was well located to wasn't really visible from anyone else's balcony. The whole aprtment was immaculate and finished to a high standard and it really did feel like home from home. There was a good sized swimming pool, basketball and pickle ball courts just outside the apartment building. There were also free to use gas barbeques dotted around outside as well. The reception area of Royal Palms is like a hotel lobby and includes a small shop for essentials. They organise a schedule of daily events for kids there as well. Being located in the grounds of the Marriott World Center hotel all of the facilities of that hotel are free to use as well. A shuttle bus runs on demand from Royal Palms to the main hotel when you want it to. The pool in the main hotel is huge and includes waiter service to your sunlounger and you can charge back to your Royal Palms apartment - too easy!! We didn't use the golf course but my son asked if he could try putting on the practice greens and the pro shop lent him a putter and some golf balls - a really nice touch and something that would never happen in England where we live! With two teenage kids this aprtment worked really well for us as everyone had enough space to chill!! I'd recommend Royal Palms to anyone, it was excellent and especially good for a family holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed all our expectations”
Reviews.Author: KeithFromNY
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4-night stay with two 3-day WDW passes as an American Express Rewards package. We had a beautiful and very spacious two-bedroom suite overlooking a golf course. The rooms, patio and fixtures were all in excellent condition and everything we could possibly want (except food) was in the suite when we arrived, right down to a box of detergent in the laundry room. The oversized Jacuzzi in the master bedroom was a very nice touch and relaxing after a long day walking the parks. We never heard a sound from our neighbors upstairs or on either side of our suite. Housekeeping was impeccable, there's a convenient mini-mart onsite, and the staff at the desk was very friendly and helpful. Wireless Internet was fast and free. Best of all, it's less than a 10 minute drive to any of the Disney parks from the property, making it very easy to come back to the suite for a shower and lunch break each day. My only suggestion is that they upgrade the TVs to flat panels. We would definitely stay here again at the hotel's regular rates!

Reviews.Title: “All around favorite!”
Reviews.Author: Lowkeytraveler55
Reviews.Content: The Royal Palms with 2 bedrooms is one of three timeshare properties at the World Center. The room was very spacious with great soundproofing in the walls and tastefuly up-to-date decor. The kitchen was well stocked and layed out for easy use. The washer/dryer in the unit was in good condition and used many times during our stay. I have to say the entire staff from the front desk, shuttle driver, grounds crew, to maitenance was very friendly and always said hello. We had no issues during our stay except the kitchen tile floor appeared to be mopped with dirty water. The shuttle takes you very quickly to any of the properties, but do watch out for wet van seats! Apparently people use the pool at the World Center (it's huge) and come back on the shuttle wet! We are from only about 2 hours from the area and know all of the roads well. My biggest suggestion is to have a car, get a good map, and don't be afraid to venture out. There is a lot to see beyond the theme parks. All of us agreed that we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Smoked Away”
Reviews.Author: MemorableWeekends
Reviews.Content: We tried to book Imperial Palms where we stayed last year, but there was no room so we welcomed the chance to stay in a 2 bedroom 2 bath villa at Royal Palms. Upon arrival, our villa was spotless and meticulously clean. Like Imperial Palms, the rooms are elegantly furnished, very spacious, filled with light and from our lanai we had a wonderful view of the golf course. We enjoyed two days at Disney, and another day at Universal. Having breakfast at the World Center Solaris restaurant is such a treat. Everything seemed to be going well until we smelled smoke. Although our confirmation certificate clearly states that Marriott Royal Palms is a smoke-free resort and there are signs everywhere on the villas and the property, we were really disappointed about poor enforcement and the lack of regard that some guests have for others. We had to close the sliding door of the lanai to keep the smoke out. We were really turned off at the Royal Palms pool because we noticed several employees and guests smoking and drinking. Even though there were lots of children playing in and around the pool, there were cigarette butts on the pool deck and near the BBQ grill. To avoid these conditions, we took the shuttle to the World Center pool. Midpoint during our stay, we encountered guests in the next villa who said that they requested to be moved because of the smoke, but could not be accomodated because of high occupancy. Smoked away, they left. Eventually, the smoke did go away and we could enjoy being on the lanai again. I'm glad we stayed to complete our vacation. I just wish the smoking imagery is not part of the memory. Because of that, I give the Royal Palms average marks in service due to lax and ineffective enforcement of their non-smoking policies.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK!”
Reviews.Author: CeeJay000
Reviews.Content: My family of six; husband, 4 kids ages 10 to 15 and myself arrived on Monday March 30 for a five night stay using Marriott Reward Points. (We are also Marriott Vacation Club Owners.) The Villas are on the same property as the Marriott Orlando World Center. The grounds of the World Center and it's golf course are absolutely meticulous but the grounds in the Villa area (Royal Palms, Sabal Palms and Imperial Palms) are just OK...not bad but not like the World Center. The amenties at the World Center are four/five star but the ones in the Villa area are not. Again, not bad but not like the World Center. There is a shuttle to take you to and from the World Center but hold on to your belongings. The ride from the Villas to the World Center is very bumpy (speed bumps) and my new digital camera fell unknowingly out of my pocket. When I realized it 10-15 minutes later and called for the shuttle to get it, it was already gone???? The Royal Palms unit we stayed in was generally spacious and the kitchen looked to have been updated within the last couple of years. It was nice. The living room, dining room and master bedroom were very spacious. The problem our family had was with the second bedroom. Although there is a double bed and a built in day bed there was no room to move around in the room. There is a sleeper sofa in the living room which was not comfortable at all so we ended up putting the mattress on the floor. The rooms were lightly cleaned and tidied daily and fresh towels were always available. Although we didn't use it, there is room service but it's not provided by Marriott. The entrance to Walt Disney World is maybe 1/4 mile out the main entrance to the World Center so it's definitely conveniently located to Mickey. Overall, it was OK but I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Good Time”
Reviews.Author: llent3932
Reviews.Content: Mariott Royal Palms has lovely 2 bedroom condos that have elegant furnishings and granite countertops. The use of the Mariott World Center is a definite perk. All hotel pools were heated. Our children used the very nice basketball courts, and enjoyed the activities such as Hoops contest, DJ music, Wii tournament and the easy access to all of the pools. There were plenty of games and sports equipment to check out from the front desk. The shuttle is easy and convenient to Mariott World Center. Condos have plenty of space and are well-appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: jaybeeBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: We had a great week's vacation here! Service was excellent, office staff helpful, and facility was just as advertised. Best of all was that all guests are encouraged to use the stupendous pool at the Marriott World Hotel. It is HUGE, spotlessly clean, and complete with waterfalls and water slide! It's a 10-minute walk from the Palms, but if your'e lazy, there is complimentary van service always available on demand. All in all, I would return in a New York minute!!!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel who needs Housekeeping help”
Reviews.Author: animason
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location, located just outside Disney. Room had up to date decor, but was not cleaned really well. We had some issues with the bathroom being clean and the floors being clean as well. We also had a drain that was full of other guests hair that would not drain. The only reason I know what it was, was because I had to clean it out. Both bath tubs in the room were of equal disappointment and we did not feel comfortable bathing our child in the tub. Hotel was nice, except for the cleaning issues.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: elenalbius
Reviews.Content: It is a paradise. The park, the green, the palms. The suite was fantastic, wide and perfect to relax

Reviews.Title: “Tired and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jaybe184
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Orlando this year as the dollar was so good for UK travellers and we booked a 2 -bed in the Royal Palms. As we've stayed in Marriott in Europe on a few occasions, we were looking forward to our trip. However, Marriott have really let themselves down in Orlando. This was probably great in the 70's but nothing's been done since then. The furnishings were tired, the technology old and the whole place felt like it needed a good spring clean. The "marketplace" had no fresh produce and was small and limited. The location was good but they didn't even offer a shuttle bus service to any of the parks. All in all very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Jensigg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our two boys stayed in a 2 BR 2 BA condo for four nights. WONDERFUL!! I will admit we stayed for a timeshare preview and we were very leary. The staff when we arrived were all very nice and they quickly checked is in and sent us on our way. We arrived at our complex which was at the very end of the property across from the highway. Not loud at all, in fact is was really peaceful. We had a view that overlooked the golf course and the pond, really a great spot. We walked into our room and our jaws hit the floor. It was so beautiful, tile on the floors and granite countertops, fab decor, huge master bedroom with a whirlpool tub that would probably fit all four of us, the bedding I wanted to bring home with us and the best thing off all was the cute little bottles of Bath and Body Works shampoo. If your are anything like me that shampoo made my whole stay. The kids room was smaller than ours but it had a queen bed and twin daybed which they took turns sleeping on. We slept and felt like we were at home. I think the unit was around 1300 sq ft. Not bad. We had access to the Marriott World Center pools and tose were big hits with the kids too. Finally our presentaion; it was not all that bad. It took about 180min instead of the 90 they tell you it will be but we did ask some questions. They wanted you to buy dont get me wrong and they pulled out all the stops but when we said "NO" they listened. We are not timeshare owners, it was not for us BUT if you are in the market I would check em' out.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Palms was AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: websam
Reviews.Content: Ok, so we arrived at 5pm on check in day (Sunday) GPS had a little trouble finding the correct street, because of the remodel. If it tells you a street that has a closed up old gate, keep going and turn right onto World Drive, it's right there. Gorgeous property, beautiful lobby/pool - even the pool bathroom was really nice! We had to hit that right away before even checking in - my daughter couldn't wait! Now we did book this place on exchange w/our timeshare, so we did not go to the timeshare presentation they wanted us to have, but the offer was good. They said $100 disney money. Anyway... The resort had elevators and luggage carts to take your stuff upstairs, which was GREAT! The resort was absolutely beautiful. I couldn't tell you a THING wrong with the place. The kitchen had a frige, toaster, oven/stove, microhood, all that stuff. Had pots/pans/bowls, utensils, large spoons and stuff/TONS of storage space. Now our toaster did burn the crap out of everything we put in it but we called and within an hour they brought us a brand new one. The kitchen counter had 3 stools and the dining table had 5 chairs. The living room had a couch and 3 chairs. The patio was screened and private. The master bedroom had a sliding glass door like the one in the living room, and both rooms exited to the same patio. The master bed was not "Marriott soft" but the bedding was of Marriott Quality. Two sinks in the bathroom with a HUGE mirror. Jacuzzi tub was great but NOT round as photographed in earlier units. There was a big closet with a safe in it, a shower/toilet area within a separate door. The second bedroom contained a queen or full size bed and a daybed, a bit small - but it worked. There were tvs in both bedrooms and of course the living room. Also, your unit does come with a full size washer and dryer. The descriptions I saw said "on property" - but I found that we had our own. That's really all there is to say except the staff was really great, no real complaints, and I have uploaded some photos but I've got many more to put up. I probably took 30-40 pics. All in all, it was a great place to stay and I would DEFINITELY stay here again, and recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not Great stay at Royal Palms”
Reviews.Author: TravlinTXFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property using Marriott Reward points with two children ages 1 and 3. We chose it based on the location to Disney and the kitchen a and 2 bedrooms and 2 baths. As other reviewers have said, the villa looks great at first glance. Granite countertops, a nice sink, newer microwave and oven/stove really have a wow factor when you walk through the door. The beds look nice. After that, our floors were pretty dingy and we too had mold in our master shower area. Really not acceptable. Most of the unit was clean on arrival, however, the housekeeping went downhill every day. Most I could tell they did was take out trash, replace towels and run the dishwasher with the coffee maker in it. I do not agree with some reviews that the kitchen was fully stocked. There wasn't even a pizza cutter or a measuring cups in our unit. Lots of glasses, cups, plates, utensils, etc. Our check in was great (around Noon on a Wednesday) and we had a pack and play delivered immediately upon check in. I asked for a high chair that was also immediately delivered. Very nice when you have a one year old with you. We also had a nice golf course view. We did not use the pool or any other amenities so I can't comment. All in all our stay was fine, but I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Royal Palms”
Reviews.Author: mariaw888
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Marriott Royal Palms in Orlando. The resort is on the property of the Marriott Convention Center and has full use of all of their facilities including the large outdoor pool and an indoor pool as well.The location is perfect for families driving to Disney World. It is on rt. 536 which is very close to Downtown Disney and will bring you right to all the parks without even getting on the major rt. 4. The resort itself is very clean. The pool is nice and we found it to be warmer than the large pool at the convention center. The two hot tubs were nice and hot and clean as well. I was a little worried that our room wouldn't be ready for hours when we went to check in around 3:30,because the gentleman checking in before me had a list of requests for his room. He wanted a first floor room as far away from the pool as possible. The woman at the desk politely told him his room would be ready around 5:30. When I checked in I didn't request anything specific and was immediately given a very nice room on the second floor. Maybe a total of 10 steps up, not a problem at all. The pool area is quiet , most of the kids want to go to the big pool because it has a water slide. The units have all been recently renovated with granite countertops. It looks nice but on closer inspection the cabinets are really cheap laminate and no flat screen TVs. Not sure if I would be willing to pay top dollar to stay here but I was happy to attend Marriott's 90 minute timeshare tour to stay here 4 nights for $199.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay at Royal Palms”
Reviews.Author: welovetravel
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one week stay at the Royal Palms. We were on a mini- family reunion and booked 4 villas with mixed reviews. On the plus side, the location is fantastic. Very close to disney, sea world and outlet shopping. The units are large and have been "renovated" (more on the renovations later). The beds were comfortable. The men in our group enjoyed the golf course and the facilities at the World Centre are nice ( you had to call for a shuttle bus to get there because they do charge for parking even it you are a guest at the villas). Now for the negatives. I have to say that the hotel did not set a good first impression because although checkin time is 4pm, half of our rooms were not ready until 5pm and the other half not until almost 6:30. We were travelling with 5 young children aged 4, 3, 2, 1 and 6 months and had nowhere to let them rest. When we inquired at the front desk, they were unable to even give us an approximation of when the rooms would be ready, citing "it's different every day" and refused to even try to find out. We could not understand how difficult it would be to call housekeeping to get this information. As far as the renovations go, on first glance the rooms looked quite nice. The kitchens appeared to be recently painted and countertops and blacksplash may have been upgrade. Upon closer inspection, there were many problems. In three of the four villas the outdated dishwashers leaked in leaving a puddle of water in the middle of the kitchen, one of the refrigerators leaked. Throughout the villas things were not completed (eg: electrical outlets loose or not working). Not a huge deal, but the inattention to details was obvious. Again not a big deal, but the clock radio was like the one my parents used in the early 70s! After the expense of going through a "renovation" to modernize the place, they did not even bother to change the clock radios. I am aware that I am nit-picking but these details just affected my overall impression of the resort. Outside of maybe the kitchen countertop, the rest of the renovation did not feel very luxurious. The other issue I had was the cleanliness of the units. The carpets were obviously seldomly vacuumed. Our first day there the kids' feet were black after running around the carpet for an hour. The most bothersome was the brown and black mildew all along the bottom of the shower curtains in the bathrooms. When we mentioned it to housekeeping, they tried to clean it with a bar of soap, initially denying my request to have the curtain replaced. After some insistence they did eventually replace it. However, in my sister's room she decided to avoid this bathtub but made no mention of it to housekeeping. After a whole week, the mildew was still there. It just seems that the staff do not pay attention to details. We go to Orlando once or twice a year and would most likely not return. We stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacation Club on I-Drive last year and loved it, beautiful units and a much more luxurious feel. We chose Royal Palms this year because of the ability to use World Centre facilities and the advertised "complete renovation". In the end we still had a great time on our vacation, but would not return to Royal Palms.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a refurb'd room!! Luxurious units!”
Reviews.Author: DivaGirl100
Reviews.Content: This property is in the middle of a renovation..(a badly needed one..) I am a travel professional and was hesitatant about staying at this property based on passed reviews. At check-in I requested an upgraded unit. We were SO pleased with our unit. Luxurious linens on the beds, high end upgrades, granite countertops. Beautiful! I am an extremely picky traveler, and believe me you won't be disappointed. The front desk staff was so helpful (even before they knew I was a travel agent.) and always went out of their way to assist. You can also purchase your park tickets right in the lobby, very convienant. All units have a screened in porch or balcony which is very nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Refurbushed Unit”
Reviews.Author: Jackman1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in newly redone unit 4270. 3rd floor unit overlooked the golf course. Excellent space, nice decor, 2 bed/2 bath, full kitchen, W/D, LR/screened patio off. Easy check in/out. 4pm in out by 10am. They have changing room/shower near lobby. Small pool but a 3 minute shuttle brings you free to the marriott with a super size pool, slide, hot tubs. We had a problem with the oven the first day(element caught fire on new stove) and they replaced stove in 10 minutes. I guess they were happy I contained the situation. Location is perfect and less than 10 minutes to all Disney Parks.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: MontrealMaria
Reviews.Content: We were totally happy with our stay at the Royal Palms! We are a family of 5, 2 adults and 3 teenage boys. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa for 8 nights from July 21 to July 29th. It was clean, spacious and the beds extremely comfortable! I was a little hesitant that I had booked this resort because the reviews were not all very appealing on trip advisor. We even had discussed cancelling our stay here. We were so glad we didn't. The location to all the theme parks was excellent and an easy drive. We arrived at the resort at about 1am due to our flight being late. The desk clerk promptly gave us our room keys. We had ordered groceries from [--] and the concierge brought all the groceries to our room and put them in our refrigerator even though we had not yet checked in. (i had scheduled to have the groceries arrive at 5PM since our flight was supposed to arrive at 4pm). The room service did a wonderful job each day cleaning up after us. The kitchen had all the amenities to cook a thanksgiving dinner! Although we made little use of it except for breakfast every morning and a couple of dinners. We were always out at the parks. The grounds were also very well taken care of. The pool at Royal Palms was very nice although we spent a whole afternoon at the Marriotts World Convention Center. There the pools are amazing! The shuttle was always available to take us as soon as we asked for it. Our sons used the pool a couple of other times after we came home from the parks! We booked the Royal Palms on a marketing package with the obligation to to listen to their 90 minute timeshare pitch at the Horizons. This too we were a little bit skeptical at first after booking but we could not refuse the great deal! $199 for 4 nights! The presentation lasted only about 75 minutes since we made it very clear that we were not interested in buying into the timeshare. The saleslady did here speech and quickly signed us out. We had a 7:30 AM appointment, only my husband and I went. After finishing the presentation, we went back to the Royal Palms woke up the boys and headed to Universal studios! We had rented a car so traveling was extremely convenient from the Royal palms to any of the parks. I would recommend this resort to anyone for the value that it is! It is great for families that want privacy, space, convenience, and good value!

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: luv2lounge
Reviews.Content: This was a timeshare stay. My boyfriend and I stayed for 1 week. Bad things- Maybe I am being too picky, but the bed linens were horrible. The sheets were so worn that you could see right through them and they looked dirty. The furniture was so dirty it needs to be cleaned. We had three lizards in our room. Good things-Nice size 2 bedroom. Nice pool area. Nice if you have a big family. Maybe a 3 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kg1012
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Royal Palms and had a great time! I went with my fiance (we're 23) from May 26- June 2. We loved our room, it was very clean when we arrived and it even was ready early for us. The pool was pretty nice, but the one at the other hotel was awesome. The shuttle service was prompt and convenient, so it was no problem getting there. The only thing I didn't like was that our jacuzzi tub didn't work. We rented a car and I would highly recommend doing so because it allows you the freedom to do what you want, when you want. I would definitely go again!

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: fln8tv
Reviews.Content: The first two-bedroom villa they sent us to had not been cleaned - filthy counter tops, dirty cups in sink, trash can flipped over on the floor, the master bed didn't even have sheets on it. The next villa we were sent to did have sheets but the lack of cleanliness was similar. And both rooms smelled like smoke. My husband is a Marriott Rewards member and we have stayed at many extremely nice hotels in this chain but will never stay here again or recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Marriott Royal Palms”
Reviews.Author: erenee
Reviews.Content: We visited the Marriott Royal Palms in March 06. We picked the locale since its in very close proximity to the Disney parks. My child was 3 at the time so she loved that idea. The staff was friendly and wonderful. There's plenty to do right on site. Since they had a shuttle running continously to the main hotel (Marriott's World Center), we just traveled back and forth to go to fabulous restaurants and visit the pool. (You have got to see the Marriott's pool. My best friend is still talking about it. I think we had more fun on the slide than the kids did.) The location is more than perfect. We cooked and ate most meals in which was not a problem. A Publix and Super Walmart are just a couple of miles away. Even the items the Palms sold in their store weren't too outrageously priced. The only complaint I had was that I requested a non-smoking room which was unavailable when I checked in. We opted for the smoking room and later noticed that the upholstery of the living room couch had holes in it from cigarette burns. The Master Bed was great. One of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The 2nd Bedroom was not as comfortable , but nevertheless it served its purpose. Overall I was very impressed. I've stayed with Marriott before on multiple occassion, but this was my first time at a Vacation Club. I really feel I got my money's worth. It most definitely will not be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Prom weeken”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal Palms April 22, 2006 for one night. I had read the old reivews and was thinking about changing my mind. I am a senior in high school and we stayed iver there for prom weeken. It was four of us who stayed so we could split the cost. I stayed in the master room and I thought that it was great. We had three big size TVs with all the channels in the villa. ( HBO, music and more). There was lots of room for all of us and the beds was so comfortable. I didnt want to get up. Prom ended at 12:00 so that means that all the food places were closed so we went to Wal- mart and bought some food to cook because there is a full kitchen wit stuff already in there to cook with. The people there were nice and called me when I asked for my wake up call. We didnt want to leave. I would stay there again if I had the money.

HotelInfo.Name: Marriott's Royal Palms
HotelInfo.Address: 8404 Vacation Way, Orlando, FL 32821
